books.title: Data Structures
books.author: Narasimha Karumanchi
books.description: This book covers fundamental and advanced data structures. It includes problem-solving techniques and practical examples that are useful for interviews and exams.

books.title: Clean Code
books.author: Robert C. Martin
books.description: A handbook of agile software craftsmanship. It explains principles, patterns, and best practices for writing clean, maintainable, and efficient code.

books.title: Design Patterns
books.author: Erich Gamma
books.description: This book introduces reusable design patterns that help developers create flexible and maintainable software. It is a classic reference for object-oriented design.

books.title: Artificial Intelligence
books.author: Stuart Russell
books.description: Comprehensive guide to AI, covering search algorithms, machine learning, robotics, and natural language processing. A must-read for AI students and researchers.

books.title: Machine Learning
books.author: Tom Mitchell
books.description: One of the earliest standard textbooks in machine learning. It explains concepts like decision trees, neural networks, and probabilistic models with clarity.

books.title: Operating Systems
books.author: Abraham Silberschatz
books.description: Classic OS concepts explained with real-world examples. Topics include process management, memory, storage, and distributed systems.

books.title: Database System Concepts
books.author: Raghu Ramakrishnan
books.description: A complete guide to database system design, SQL queries, normalization, and distributed databases. Widely used as an academic textbook.

books.title: C++ Primer
books.author: Stanley Lippman
books.description: Comprehensive coverage of C++ programming language with practical coding examples. Suitable for both beginners and professionals.

books.title: Java: The Complete Reference
books.author: Herbert Schildt
books.description: Detailed explanation of Java concepts, libraries, and APIs. This book is considered the bible for Java programmers worldwide.

books.title: Cyber Security Basics
books.author: William Stallings
books.description: Introduces cyber security threats, cryptography, and defensive techniques. It provides real-world case studies and strategies.

books.title: Computer Networks
books.author: Andrew S. Tanenbaum
books.description: In-depth coverage of networking principles, protocols, and architectures. A must-have for networking students and professionals.

books.title: Python Crash Course
books.author: Eric Matthes
books.description: Beginner-friendly introduction to Python with projects on games, web apps, and data visualization. Perfect for self-learners.

books.title: Deep Learning
books.author: Ian Goodfellow
books.description: Definitive book on deep learning, covering neural networks, optimization, and modern architectures. Written by pioneers in the field.

books.title: HTML & CSS: Design and Build Websites
books.author: Jon Duckett
books.description: Visually rich introduction to HTML and CSS for beginners. Includes diagrams and step-by-step tutorials.

books.title: JavaScript: The Good Parts
books.author: Douglas Crockford
books.description: Highlights the most effective features of JavaScript. Provides insights into writing efficient, clean, and bug-free JS code.

books.title: You Don’t Know JS
books.author: Kyle Simpson
books.description: Deep dive into the inner workings of JavaScript. Each volume covers specific areas like scope, closures, async, and performance.

books.title: Modern Operating Systems
books.author: Andrew S. Tanenbaum
books.description: Updated edition covering modern OS architectures, security, and virtualization concepts. Widely used as a reference book.

books.title: Linux Basics for Hackers
books.author: OccupyTheWeb
books.description: Practical guide for beginners to learn Linux with hacking tools and commands. Great for ethical hackers and security students.

books.title: Ethical Hacking
books.author: Rafay Baloch
books.description: Detailed book on penetration testing, ethical hacking methods, and modern cyber threats with case studies.

books.title: Cloud Computing: Principles and Paradigms
books.author: Rajkumar Buyya
books.description: Covers foundations of cloud computing including virtualization, SaaS, IaaS, and distributed systems.

books.title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
books.author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
books.description: This book teaches the difference between working for money and making money work for you. It focuses on financial independence and investment strategies.

books.title: Think and Grow Rich
books.author: Napoleon Hill
books.description: A timeless classic on personal development and success, teaching the power of thoughts, persistence, and goal-setting.

books.title: The Intelligent Investor
books.author: Benjamin Graham
books.description: Known as the bible of investing, this book teaches principles of value investing and risk management.

books.title: The Lean Startup
books.author: Eric Ries
books.description: A guide for entrepreneurs on how to build successful startups using lean principles, experimentation, and validated learning.

books.title: Zero to One
books.author: Peter Thiel
books.description: Insights on innovation, monopoly building, and creating businesses that go from zero to something new and unique.

books.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
books.author: Stephen R. Covey
books.description: Powerful habits for personal and professional effectiveness, focusing on character ethics and proactive behavior.

books.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
books.author: Dale Carnegie
books.description: Classic book on communication, persuasion, and leadership skills to succeed personally and professionally.

books.title: Atomic Habits
books.author: James Clear
books.description: Explains how small daily habits lead to remarkable results. Practical techniques to build good habits and break bad ones.

books.title: Principles
books.author: Ray Dalio
books.description: Billionaire investor Ray Dalio shares life and work principles that helped him build Bridgewater Associates.

books.title: The 4-Hour Workweek
books.author: Timothy Ferriss
books.description: Guides on designing a lifestyle of financial freedom, remote work, and automation to escape the 9-to-5 grind.

books.title: Start with Why
books.author: Simon Sinek
books.description: Explains the importance of purpose-driven leadership and how great leaders inspire action by starting with 'Why'.

books.title: Good to Great
books.author: Jim Collins
books.description: Research-backed book on why some companies transition from good to great while others don’t.

books.title: Blue Ocean Strategy
books.author: W. Chan Kim & Renée Mauborgne
books.description: Teaches how to create uncontested market space and make competition irrelevant.

books.title: The Power of Habit
books.author: Charles Duhigg
books.description: Explores the science of habits and how they shape our lives, with strategies to change them.

books.title: The Art of War
books.author: Sun Tzu
books.description: Ancient Chinese military strategy text, widely applied in business, leadership, and decision-making.

issues.bookName: HTML & CSS: Design and Build Websites

fines.bookName: HTML & CSS: Design and Build Websites
